ænet Tools Documentation¶

The aenet tools package is a collection of utilities for preparing input files and processing output files for the machine-learning potential software ænet (http://ann.atomistic.net).

Common use cases of the package are

  • Extraction of structures, energies, and forces from the output of first-principles calculations;

  • Interconversion of atomic structure formats, especially conversion to ænet’s XSF format;

  • Manipulation of atomic structure, e.g., for generating reference data;

  • Operations on the featurized reference data produced by ænet’s generate.x; and

  • Analysis of the output generated by ænet’s train.x, i.e., from machine-learning potential training.

Much of the package’s functionality is exposed through command-line tools. See Command-line interface for an overview of the command-line capabilities.
